◆ cant_do()

task_reason veh_interact::cant_do ( char  mode)
private

Checks if the player is able to perform some command, and returns a nonzero error code if they are unable to perform it.

The return from this function should be passed into the various do_whatever functions further down.

Parameters
modeThe command the player is trying to perform (i.e. 'r' for repair).
Returns
CAN_DO if the player has everything they need, INVALID_TARGET if the command can't target that square, LACK_TOOLS if the player lacks tools, NOT_FREE if something else obstructs the action, LACK_SKILL if the player's skill isn't high enough, LOW_MORALE if the player's morale is too low while trying to perform an action requiring a minimum morale, UNKNOWN_TASK if the requested operation is unrecognized.

3214  if( vp.is_tank() && src->is_container() && !src->empty() ) {
3215  item_location contained( src, &src->only_item() );
3216  contained->charges -= vp.base.fill_with( *contained, contained->charges );
3217 
3218  contents_change_handler handler;
3219  handler.unseal_pocket_containing( contained );
3220 
3221  // if code goes here, we can assume "vp" has already refilled with "contained" something.
3222  int remaining_ammo_capacity = vp.ammo_capacity( contained->ammo_type() ) - vp.ammo_remaining();
3223 
3224  if( remaining_ammo_capacity ) {
3225  //~ 1$s vehicle name, 2$s tank name
3226  you.add_msg_if_player( m_good, _( "You refill the %1$s's %2$s." ), veh.name, vp.name() );
3227  } else {
3228  //~ 1$s vehicle name, 2$s tank name
3229  you.add_msg_if_player( m_good, _( "You completely refill the %1$s's %2$s." ), veh.name, vp.name() );
3230  }
3231 
3232  if( contained->charges == 0 ) {
3233  contained.remove_item();
3234  } else {
3235  you.add_msg_if_player( m_good, _( "There's some left over!" ) );
3236  }
3237 
3238  handler.handle_by( you );
3239  } else if( vp.is_fuel_store() ) {
3240  contents_change_handler handler;
3241  handler.unseal_pocket_containing( src );
3242 
3243  int qty = src->charges;
3244  vp.base.reload( you, std::move( src ), qty );
3245 
3246  //~ 1$s vehicle name, 2$s reactor name
3247  you.add_msg_if_player( m_good, _( "You refuel the %1$s's %2$s." ), veh.name, vp.name() );
3248 
3249  handler.handle_by( you );
3250  } else {
3251  debugmsg( "vehicle part is not reloadable" );
3252  break;
3253  }
3254 
3255  veh.invalidate_mass();
3256  break;
3257  }
3258 
3259  case 'O': // 'O' = remove appliance
3260  case 'o': {
3261  int vp_index = you.activity.values[6];
3262  if( vp_index >= veh.part_count() ) {
3263  vp_index = veh.get_next_shifted_index( vp_index, you );
3264  if( vp_index == -1 ) {
3265  you.add_msg_if_player( m_info,
3266  //~ 1$s is the vehicle part name
3267  _( "The %1$s has already been removed by someone else." ),
3268  vpinfo.name() );
3269  return;
3270  }
3271  }
3272  vehicle_part *vp = &veh.part( vp_index );
3273  const vpart_info &vpi = vp->info();
3274  const bool appliance_removal = static_cast<char>( you.activity.index ) == 'O';
3275  const bool wall_wire_removal = appliance_removal && vpi.id == vpart_ap_wall_wiring;
3276  const bool broken = vp->is_broken();
3277  const bool smash_remove = vpi.has_flag( "SMASH_REMOVE" );
3278  const inventory &inv = you.crafting_inventory();
3279  const requirement_data &reqs = vpi.removal_requirements();
3280  if( !reqs.can_make_with_inventory( inv, is_crafting_component ) ) {
3281  //~ 1$s is the vehicle part name
3282  add_msg( m_info, _( "You don't meet the requirements to remove the %1$s." ), vpi.name() );
3283  break;
3284  }
3285  for( const auto &e : reqs.get_components() ) {
3286  you.consume_items( e, 1, is_crafting_component );
3287  }
3288  for( const auto &e : reqs.get_tools() ) {
3289  you.consume_tools( e );
3290  }
3291 
3292  you.invalidate_crafting_inventory();
3293 
3294  // This will be a list of all the items which arise from this removal.
3295  std::list<item> resulting_items;
3296 
3297  // First we get all the contents of the part
3298  vehicle_stack contents = veh.get_items( *vp );
3299  resulting_items.insert( resulting_items.end(), contents.begin(), contents.end() );
3300  contents.clear();
3301 
3302  if( broken ) {
3303  you.add_msg_if_player( _( "You remove the broken %1$s from the %2$s." ), vp->name(), veh.name );
3304  } else if( smash_remove ) {
3305  you.add_msg_if_player( _( "You smash the %1$s to bits, removing it from the %2$s." ),
3306  vp->name(), veh.name );
3307  } else {
3308  you.add_msg_if_player( _( "You remove the %1$s from the %2$s." ), vp->name(), veh.name );
3309  }
3310 
3311  if( wall_wire_removal ) {
3312  veh.part_to_item( *vp ); // what's going on here? this line isn't doing anything...
3313  } else if( vpi.has_flag( "TOW_CABLE" ) ) {
3314  veh.invalidate_towing( true, &you );
3315  } else if( broken ) {
3316  item_group::ItemList pieces = vp->pieces_for_broken_part();
3317  resulting_items.insert( resulting_items.end(), pieces.begin(), pieces.end() );
3318  } else {
3319  if( smash_remove ) {
3320  item_group::ItemList pieces = vp->pieces_for_broken_part();
3321  resulting_items.insert( resulting_items.end(), pieces.begin(), pieces.end() );
3322  } else {
3323  resulting_items.push_back( veh.removed_part( *vp ) );
3324 
3325  // damage reduces chance of success (0.8^damage_level)
3326  const double component_success_chance = std::pow( 0.8, vp->damage_level() );
3327  const double charges_min = std::clamp( component_success_chance, 0.0, 1.0 );
3328  const double charges_max = std::clamp( component_success_chance + 0.1, 0.0, 1.0 );
3329  for( item &it : vp->get_salvageable() ) {
3330  if( it.count_by_charges() ) {
3331  const int charges_befor = it.charges;
3332  it.charges *= rng_float( charges_min, charges_max );
3333  const int charges_destroyed = charges_befor - it.charges;
3334  if( charges_destroyed > 0 ) {
3335  you.add_msg_player_or_npc( m_bad,
3336  _( "You fail to recover %1$d %2$s." ),
3337  _( "<npcname> fails to recover %1$d %2$s." ),
3338  charges_destroyed,
3339  it.type_name( charges_destroyed ) );
3340  }
3341  if( it.charges > 0 ) {
3342  resulting_items.push_back( it );
3343  }
3344  } else if( component_success_chance > rng_float( 0, 1 ) ) {
3345  resulting_items.push_back( it );
3346  } else {
3347  you.add_msg_player_or_npc( m_bad,
3348  _( "You fail to recover %1$s." ),
3349  _( "<npcname> fails to recover %1$s." ),
3350  it.type_name() );
3351  }
3352  }
3353  }
3354  for( const std::pair<const skill_id, int> &sk : vpi.install_skills ) {
3355  // removal is half as educational as installation
3356  you.practice( sk.first, veh_utils::calc_xp_gain( vpi, sk.first, you ) / 2 );
3357  }
3358  }
3359 
3360  // Power cables must remove parts from the target vehicle, too.
3361  if( vpi.has_flag( VPFLAG_POWER_TRANSFER ) ) {
3362  veh.remove_remote_part( *vp );
3363  }
3364 
3365  if( appliance_removal && veh.part_count() > 1 ) {
3366  // Split up power grids
3367  veh.find_and_split_vehicles( here, { vp_index } );
3368  veh.part_removal_cleanup();
3369  // Ensure the position, pivot, and precalc points are up-to-date
3370  veh.pos -= veh.pivot_anchor[0];
3371  veh.precalc_mounts( 0, veh.turn_dir, point() );
3372  here.rebuild_vehicle_level_caches();
3373 
3374  if( auto newpart = here.veh_at( act_pos ).part_with_feature( VPFLAG_APPLIANCE, false ) ) {
3375  vp = &newpart->part();
3376  } else {
3377  debugmsg( "No appliance part left to remove after splitting vehicle!" );
3378  vp = nullptr;
3379  }
3380  //always stop after removing an appliance
3381  you.activity.set_to_null();
3382  }
3383 
3384  // Save these values now so they aren't lost when parts or vehicles are destroyed.
3385  const point part_mount = vp->mount;
3386  const tripoint part_pos = veh.global_part_pos3( *vp );
3387 
3388  veh.unlink_cables( part_mount, you,
3389  false, /* unneeded as items will be unlinked if the connected part is removed */
3390  appliance_removal || vpi.location == "structure",
3391  appliance_removal || vpi.has_flag( VPFLAG_CABLE_PORTS ) || vpi.has_flag( VPFLAG_BATTERY ) );
3392 
3393  if( veh.part_count_real() <= 1 ) {
3394  you.add_msg_if_player( _( "You completely dismantle the %s." ), veh.name );
3395  you.activity.set_to_null();
3396  // destroy vehicle clears the cache
3397  here.destroy_vehicle( &veh );
3398  } else if( vp ) {
3399  veh.remove_part( *vp );
3400  // part_removal_cleanup calls refresh, so parts_at_relative is valid
3401  veh.part_removal_cleanup();
3402  if( veh.parts_at_relative( part_mount, true ).empty() ) {
3403  get_map().clear_vehicle_point_from_cache( &veh, part_pos );
3404  }
3405  }
3406  // This will be part of an NPC "job" where they need to clean up the activity
3407  // items afterwards
3408  if( you.is_npc() ) {
3409  for( item &it : resulting_items ) {
3410  it.set_var( "activity_var", you.name );
3411  }
3412  }
3413  // Finally, put all the results somewhere (we wanted to wait until this
3414  // point because we don't want to put them back into the vehicle part
3415  // that just got removed).
3416  put_into_vehicle_or_drop( you, item_drop_reason::deliberate, resulting_items );
3417  break;
3418  }
3419  case 'u': {
3420  // Unplug action just sheds loose connections,
3421  // assuming vehicle::shed_loose_parts was already called so that
3422  // the removed parts have had time to be processed
3423  you.add_msg_if_player( _( "You disconnect the %s's power connection." ), veh.name );
3424  break;
3425  }
3426  }
3427  you.invalidate_crafting_inventory();
3428  you.invalidate_weight_carried_cache();
3429 }
